full_summary:
### Tender Announcement
#### Request for Supply Arrangement for In-Water Vessel Cleaning with Capture Services

**Reference Number**: PW-__MD-046-29271
**Solicitation Number**: F7044-200268/F
**Publication Date**: January 31, 2024
**Tender Closing Date**: January 30, 2025, 2:00 PM EST

**Subject**: The Government of Canada is seeking suppliers capable of providing in-water vessel cleaning with capture services for various Government of Canada departments and agencies.

**Objective**: To maximize the performance of Canada’s vessels and preserve the marine environment by reducing the spread of aquatic invasive species.

**Geographic Scope**: This tender announcement is open to bidders from across Canada, including areas subject to Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs).

**Trade Agreements**: The tender is governed by the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Pre-Qualification Requirements**: Suppliers must have the necessary equipment and expertise to provide in-water vessel cleaning with capture services.

**Supply Arrangement**: The successful supplier will be awarded a five-year Supply Arrangement for In-Water Vessel Cleaning with Capture Services.

**Request for Proposals (RFP)**: A comprehensive RFP has been prepared and is available for download on the Government of Canada’s procurement website [https://buyandsell.gc.ca].

**Disclosure**: Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Contact Information**:

* Dianne Tinkess, Contracting Officer
* Phone: 819-271-7829
* Email: [Dianne.Tinkess@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:Dianne.Tinkess@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)

### General Information

* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
* Suppliers must use the Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect service to transmit their arrangement to the Supply Arrangement Authority.
* Further information on using this method is available in Part 2 of the RFP entitled Supplier Instructions and Part 3 of the RFP entitled Arrangement Preparation Instructions.  I corrected certain things to make the final output look more formal. The contractor provided the bid information, I rewrote it into a typical format expected in a tender announcement
